p: Our model shows that HIV virulence, using set point viral load as a proxy, can adaptively evolve in a host population. This result is consistent with previous work [12], [13], in both evolutionary processes (adaptation of HIV virulence to optimize transmission potential) and patterns (optimal SPVL âˆ¼4.75 log 10 copies/mL). It is also consistent with studies showing HIV adaptation to the human population in response to both cellular [36], [37] and humoral [38], [39] responses over the course of the epidemic.
